comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Most likely John Ellis Roosevelt (1853–1939), lawyer and cousin of Theodore Roosevelt (www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=43984481) In 1916, he was suing his wife for annulment of his marriage. He was 63 years old, his wife only 31. (The evening world., February 15, 1916, Final Edition, Page 8 col. 6, with photo of his wife). The court refused to annul the marriage (New-York tribune., March 31, 1916, Page 16, col. 3). His wife brought a suit for separation and charged him for cruelty. (New-York tribune., June 08, 1916, Page 9, Image 9, coL. 5, "J. E. ROOSEVELT DENIES CRUELTY" J. E. Roosevelt won this suit (chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030193/1916-06-26/ed-..., last column)

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: B-59: Thanks for the research and links about J. E. Roosevelt. We will expand this record when we update.
